snippet: The oil giant, still restructuring after the Gulf of Mexico spill in 2010, reported $4 billion in operating profit for the fourth quarter, down from $5 billion a year earlier.
abstract: BP reports a decline in fourth-quarter profit, reflection of asset sales made after the Gulf of Mexico disaster that have left it smaller company; posts operating earnings for the three months through December of $4 billion, down from $5 billion year earlier; operating profit for full year was $17.6 billion, down 19 percent from 2011.
lead_paragraph: The oil giant, still restructuring after the Gulf of Mexico spill in 2010, reported $4 billion in operating profit for the fourth quarter, down from $5 billion a year earlier.

headline.main: BP Earnings Fall on Lower Production and Higher Costs
headline.print_headline: BP Earnings Plummet in Line With Its Sale of Assets After the Gulf Oil Rig Explosion
